text: The Bradshaw Town Hall, also known as the Bradshaw Civic Center, is a historic building in Bradshaw, Nebraska. It was built in 1902-1903 to house town hall meetings on the first floor and Freemason conclaves on the second floor. With It was later repurposed as a community center. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since May 31, 1984. ==References== Category:National Register of Historic Places in York County, Nebraska Category:Government buildings completed in 1902 Category:Masonic buildings in Nebraska
title: Bradshaw Town Hall
